Package com.cafean.CalcServer

Class CalcServerConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.rpc.RPCManager
      • com.cafean.rpc.RPCOriginator
        • com.cafean.CalcServer.rpc.CalcServerOriginator
          • com.cafean.CalcServer.CalcServerConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class CalcServerConnector
extends CalcServerOriginator
implements java.lang.Runnable
    CalcServerConnector is a delegate Thread used to connect to a CalcServer.
    To use:
    • Implement the CalcServerClient interface for your class.
    • Create and instance of CalcServerConnector and start() it.
    • Call cancelConnection() on any active connectors before closing your app.
    • Use execMonConnected/Failed etc CalcServerClient callbacks to implement behavior that depends on having an Execution Monitor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalcServerConnector

        public CalcServerConnector​(java.lang.String name,
                           PlatformDefinition platform,
                           CalcServerClient client)
        Creates a new Calculation Server Connector object for use in connecting to the given server.
        Parameters:
        name - a String containing the context in which the connection will be used. This should be a human-readable name for use in logging and error messages.
        platform - the PlatformDefinition that describes the target.
        client - the CalcServerClient to make call-backs to.

      • CalcServerConnector

        public CalcServerConnector​(java.lang.String name,
                           PlatformProperties platform,
                           CalcServerClient client)
        Creates a new Calculation Server Connector object for use in connecting to the given server.
        Parameters:
        name - a String containing the context in which the connection will be used. This should be a human-readable name for use in logging and error messages.
        platform - the PlatformProperties used to establish the connection
        client - the CalcServerClient to make call-backs to.

      • run

        public void run()
        Attempts to make the Execution Monitor connection, then cleans up and returns. Note: Like any Thread, the run() method should not be called directly.
        Specified by:

      • isLocalAutomatic

        public static boolean isLocalAutomatic​(Configurator config)
        Returns true if this calc server connector is configured to connect to the local calculation server instance owned by the current user.
        Parameters:
        config - the Configurator to use to check the current user's "Start Automatically" property.

      • isLocalServerRunning

        public static boolean isLocalServerRunning​(boolean wait)
        Returns true if the local calculation server is currently active. This method simply checks for the existence of the Calculation Server Port File.
        Parameters:
        wait - if true and the port file exists then this method will wait up to 10 seconds for the status file to be created and/or touched before returning.

      • startCalcServer

        public void startCalcServer​(javax.swing.JFrame parent)
        Opens a blocking dialog using the given parent and begins the process of starting the local calculation server.
        See Also:
        isLocalServerRunning(boolean)

      • startCalcServer

        public static boolean startCalcServer​(java.awt.Window parent,
                                      java.io.File launcher)
        Attempts to execute the calculation server by executing the given launcher. All error messages will be displayed as option panes on the given parent.
